data: At the entrance of the village, so says Cide Hamete, Don Quixote saw two boys quarrelling on the village threshing-floor one of whom said to the other, “Take it easy, Periquillo; thou shalt never see it again as long as thou livest.”

At the entrance of the village, so says Cide Hamete, Don Quixote saw two boys quarrelling on the village threshing-floor one of whom said to the other, "Take it easy, Periquillo; thou shalt never see it again as long as thou livest."
The History of Don Quixote, Volume 2, Part 42
Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de, 1547-1616; Doré, Gustave, 1832-1883 [Illustrator]; Ormsby, John, 1829-1895 [Translator]
